content.raw:
The keys 65 and 66 are mapping to upper case `A` and `B`. Could we change these to match the other demos?

Also, after pressing A a few times, the quad bounces a bit and suddenly the model becomes dead in the world origin.
content.html:
The keys 65 and 66 are mapping to upper case A and B. Could we change these to match the other demos?

Also, after pressing A a few times, the quad bounces a bit and suddenly the model becomes dead in the world origin.

content.raw: I was trying to fly the plane demo world, then after I pressing `W` for a long time, then pressing `D`, Gazebo crashed. Before that I had a lot of `Error [Param.cc:452] Unable to set value [inf inf -inf 0 0 0] for key[pose]` messages. I am not being able to reproduce the crash, but I always end up in a state where the plane is stuck at the world origin.
content.html: I was trying to fly the plane demo world, then after I pressing W for a long time, then pressing D, Gazebo crashed. Before that I had a lot of Error [Param.cc:452] Unable to set value [inf inf -inf 0 0 0] for key[pose] messages. I am not being able to reproduce the crash, but I always end up in a state where the plane is stuck at the world origin.

content.raw: Oh ok, I see each individual key is documented. It's just not very obvious to me how to use them, but it might just be me :)
content.html: Oh ok, I see each individual key is documented. It's just not very obvious to me how to use them, but it might just be me :)

content.html: Are the supported keys explained somewhere?

update.description:
* need [this pull request from gazebo_models](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/177/aerodynamics-models/diff)
* redo pull request #2010 without the `keyhit` detector containing LGPL code
* ~~Need [this pull request for models](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/177/aerodynamics-models/diff).~~
* Adding a world file with the Cessna model and the liftDrag plugin. Controlled cessna flight by adding lift drag plugin response to control surface joint (cl only for now)
* change drag and re-orient sensor data before sending out to SIM_Gazebo
* use actual rotor speed by reducing rotorVelocitySlowdownSim from 10 to 1, and got rid of vertical and yaw coupling by adjusting cla and cda.
* [video](https://youtu.be/n_M5Vs5FBGY)
update.title: Aerodynamic updates

content.raw:
hm, it's in
~~~
/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/bits/fcntl-linux.h
~~~

dpkg shows it's included in package `libc6-dev`:

~~~
dpkg -S  /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/bits/fcntl-linux.h
libc6-dev:amd64: /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/bits/fcntl-linux.h
~~~

hm, it's in

update.description:
* need [this pull request from gazebo_models](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/177/aerodynamics-models/diff)
* redo pull request #2010 without the `keyhit` detector containing LGPL code
* ~~Need [this pull request for models](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/177/aerodynamics-models/diff).~~
* Adding a world file with the Cessna model and the liftDrag plugin. Controlled cessna flight by adding lift drag plugin response to control surface joint (cl only for now)
* change drag and re-orient sensor data before sending out to SIM_Gazebo
* use actual rotor speed by reducing rotorVelocitySlowdownSim from 10 to 1, and got rid of vertical and yaw coupling by adjusting cla and cda.
* [video](https://youtu.be/n_M5Vs5FBGY)
update.title: Aerodynamic updates

content.raw:
8510348

Added detection for whether ArduCopter is online or not. If ArduCopter is detected (receive of fdm packet from someone), then socket receive wait time is increased from 1ms to 1 sec to accomodate network instability. If ArduCopter is not detected, receive call blocks for 1ms on each call.
Once ArduCopter presence is detected, it takes 15 (configurable) missed receives before declaring the FCS offline.
content.html:
8510348

Added detection for whether ArduCopter is online or not. If ArduCopter is detected (receive of fdm packet from someone), then socket receive wait time is increased from 1ms to 1 sec to accomodate network instability. If ArduCopter is not detected, receive call blocks for 1ms on each call. Once ArduCopter presence is detected, it takes 15 (configurable) missed receives before declaring the FCS offline.
